title: How to write an autobiography without using people's names - Quora

response.answer_text: You can use their names, especially if you’re sure said people would be okay with you revealing their private matters. If that’s not the case, you can use a fake name: “I’ll call him Chester,” or just refer to the person in some other way than their actual name. It’s okay to do that. If you have to change everyone’s name due to sensational content or threat of lawsuits, then it would be better to fictionalize your story - write the brutal truth but change all names, places and other details that would give it away. If you fictionalize your story, chances are no one you’re writing about will recognize themselves, as most people have little awareness of what they’re really like.
